result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees. Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim. Once the defendant starts Batterer's Intervention Program, the No Contact Order is modified to No Violent Contact.

Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Sherril Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation Status Review from DOC agent, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for probation review hearing.  DOC agent also in court.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
4/7/16 bail refund notice mailed to surty.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No contact with victim. Once the defendant starts Batterer's Intervention Program, the No Contact Order is modified to No Violent Contact.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The state is ready to proceed.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the penalty enhancer "repeater" dismissed.
AS to count as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to counts 1 and 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 1 and 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Statement by the victim, Sylvia T.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
State's Witness List received and filed.
The defendant is currently in MSDF and the DA is to do an order to produce for the next court date.
Case continued for trial on 03/07/2016 at 08:30 a.m., in Branch 36.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for public defender representation.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Status of Counsel scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sylvia T., Adrian R., Jasceilia A. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Marvin Sherril Taylor in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-245
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
